mods:mods.mods:abstract: Family news. Did not attend the Bedford court because he is reluctant to be unnecessarily absent from his office, having lost much business recently by absence. Hopes the Corporation will soon repay the assessment. All the affected proprietors except John Jay and Trinity Church agreed to contest it; Peter declined joining them, being a member of the common council and not believing that the court of chancery had jurisdiction on the subject. It was then agreed that the proprietors would undertake the suit provided all those who benefited by their success would contribute to the expense in proportion to their assessments. Thinks that by this action Jay will save about $5,000. Thinks Clinton will be a candidate for the Presidency if he carries New York. In the city Crawford is losing ground, Adams supported because an easterner, Jefferson in favor of Clinton. His son-in-law, Governor Randolph, has been there to assist Clinton (Peter believes), as has Mr. Williams of Ohio.
